etomica.util

Class HistoryCollapsing

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.util.HistoryCollapsing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    History
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HistoryCollapsingDiscard

    public abstract class HistoryCollapsing
extends java.lang.Object
implements History
    History that records a number of values. When existing space is insufficient to hold new data, the existing data is "collapsed" such that all existing data is stored in the first half of existing storage by dropping every other data point. After that point data will be taken half as often.

    • Method Detail

      • setHistoryLength

        public void setHistoryLength(int n)
        Sets the number of values kept in the history. If more data is contained in the history than the set length, the existing data is collapsed until it fits within the new length. History length must be at least 2.
        Specified by:
        setHistoryLength in interface History

      • getHistoryLength

        Description copied from interface: History
        Returns the number of data points tracked by the History.

        Specified by:
        getSampleCount in interface History

      • setNumCollapseBins

        public void setNumCollapseBins(int newNumCollapseBins)
        Sets the number of "collapse" bins. When the data is collapsed, one value will be taken from each consecutive n bins, where n is the number of bins set by this method. The value will be taken from the middle bin or (for an even number of bins), taken from the bin to the left of the middle.

      • getNumCollapseBins

        public int getNumCollapseBins()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Removes entire history, setting all values to NaN. After calling reset, data will be recorded at every interval.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface History

      • getXValues
